CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 27, 1940, pg. 21, reads: "Harlem Casino Sensation - The perfect figure and the sensational 'snake-hips' dance of talented and attractive Myrtle Wilson are combining to form a sensation at Pittsburgh's Harlem Casino, Gus Greenlee's black and tan nitery. The young lady with the 'perfect brown body and oriental features' is a holdover at the spot.  Others being featured are Lois Deppe, baritone; titian-haired Lillian Young, hot-cha singer, and LeRoy Brown's orchestra, with Honeyboy Minor on the drums."
TitMainTitle: Myrtle Wilson in satin belly dancing costume performing on stage, with mural of dancers, at Harlem Casino, another version
